018package org.tquadrat.foundation.value.api;
019
020import static java.math.RoundingMode.HALF_EVEN;
021import static java.util.FormattableFlags.LEFT_JUSTIFY;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNotEmptyArgument;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.padRight;
028
029import java.io.Serializable;
030import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
031import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
032import java.math.BigDecimal;
033import java.math.MathContext;
034import java.util.Formattable;
035import java.util.Formatter;
036import java.util.IllegalFormatException;
037import java.util.Locale;
038
039import org.apiguardian.api.API;
040import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
041import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.UnexpectedExceptionError;
042
043/**
044 *  The definition for a value with a dimension. <br>
045 *  <br>Although the unit for the dimension may be changed, instances of
046 *  classes implementing this interface can be assumed to be immutable as the
047 *  <i>value</i> remains always the same. So at least the results of the
048 *  methods
049 *  {@link #equals(Object)},
050 *  {@link #hashCode()},
051 *  and
052 *  {@link #compareTo(DimensionedValue)}
053 *  will remain always the same
054 *  (while the results from
055 *  {@link #toString()}
056 *  may differ after a call to
057 *  {@link #setUnit(Dimension)}).<br>
058 *  <br>All concrete (non-abstract) implementations of this interface should be
059 *  {@code final}.
060 *
061 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
062 *  @version $Id: DimensionedValue.java 989 2022-01-13 19:09:58Z tquadrat $
063 *  @since 0.1.0
064 *
065 *  @param  <D> The dimension.
066 *
067 *  @UMLGraph.link
068 */
069@SuppressWarnings( "ClassWithTooManyMethods" )
070@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: DimensionedValue.java 989 2022-01-13 19:09:58Z tquadrat $" )
071@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
072public interface DimensionedValue<D extends Dimension> extends Cloneable, Comparable<DimensionedValue<D>>, Formattable, Serializable
073{
074        /*-----------*\
075    ====** Constants **========================================================
076        \*-----------*/
077    /**
078     *  The
079     *  {@link MathContext}
080     *  that is used for all the operations with dimensioned values.
081     */
082    public static final MathContext MATH_CONTEXT = new MathContext( 128, HALF_EVEN );
083
084        /*---------*\
085    ====** Methods **==========================================================
086        \*---------*/
087    /**
088     *  Returns the base unit of the dimension for the value.
089     *
090     *  @return The base unit.
091     */
092    public default D baseUnit()
093    {
094        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
095        final var retValue = (D) getUnit().baseUnit();
096
097        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
098        return retValue;
099    }   //  baseUnit()
100
101    /**
102     *  <p>{@summary Returns the base value (this value, converted to the base
103      *  unit).}</p>
104     *  <p>According to the result, this is the same as calling</p>
105     *  <pre><code>convert( baseUnit() );</code></pre>.
106     *
107     *  @return The numerical value as for the base unit.
108     *
109     *  @see #convert(Dimension)
110     */
111    public BigDecimal baseValue();
112
113    /**
114     *  Creates a new copy of this value.
115     *
116     *  @return The copy.
117     *
118     *  @see Object#clone()
119     */
120    public DimensionedValue<D> clone();
121
122    /**
123     *  {@inheritDoc}
124     *  <p>The comparison is made based on the
125     *  {@link #baseValue()}.</p>
126     */
127    @Override
128    public default int compareTo( final DimensionedValue<D> other )
129    {
130        final var retValue = Integer.signum( baseValue().compareTo( requireNonNullArgument( other, "other" ).baseValue() ) );
131
132        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
133        return retValue;
134    }   //  compareTo()
135
136    /**
137     *  Converts this value to the given unit and returns the numerical value.
138     *
139     *  @param  unit    The unit.
140     *  @return The numerical value of this instance, based on the provided
141     *      unit.
142     *
143     *  @see #baseValue()
144     */
145    public default BigDecimal convert( final D unit )
146    {
147        final var retValue = baseValue().divide( requireNonNullArgument( unit, "unit" ).factor(), MATH_CONTEXT ).stripTrailingZeros();
148
149        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
150        return retValue;
151    }   //  convert()
152
153    /**
154     *  Creates a new copy of this value.
155     *
156     *  @return The copy.
157     *
158     *  @see Object#clone()
159     */
160    public DimensionedValue<D> copy();
161
162    /**
163     *  Creates a new copy of this value.
164     *
165     *  @param  unit    The unit for the new copy.
166     *  @return The copy.
167     *
168     *  @see Object#clone()
169     */
170    public DimensionedValue<D> copy( final D unit );
171
172    /**
173     *  Divides the value by a dimension-less value and returns the result
174     *  without changing this instance.
175     *
176     *  @param  divisor The divisor.
177     *  @return The new value.
178     */
179    public default DimensionedValue<D> divide( final BigDecimal divisor )
180    {
181        final var retValue = newInstance( baseUnit(), baseValue().divide( requireNonNullArgument( divisor, "divisor" ), MATH_CONTEXT ) );
182        retValue.setUnit( getUnit() );
183
184        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
185        return retValue;
186    }   //  divide()
187
188    /**
189     *  Divides the value by a dimension-less value and returns the result
190     *  without changing this instance.
191     *
192     *  @param  divisor The divisor.
193     *  @return The new value.
194     */
195    public default DimensionedValue<D> divide( final Number divisor )
196    {
197        final var retValue = divide( new BigDecimal( requireNonNullArgument( divisor, "divisor" ).toString() ) );
198        retValue.setUnit( getUnit() );
199
200        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
201        return retValue;
202    }   //  divide()
203
204    /**
205     *  Divides the value by a dimension-less value and returns the result
206     *  without changing this instance.
207     *
208     *  @param  divisor The divisor; it must be possible to parse the given
209     *      String into a
210     *      {@link BigDecimal}.
211     *  @return The new value.
212     *  @throws NumberFormatException   The provided value cannot be converted
213     *      into a {@code BigDecimal}.
214     *
215     *  @see BigDecimal#BigDecimal(String)
216     */
217    public default DimensionedValue<D> divide( final String divisor )
218    {
219        final var retValue = divide( new BigDecimal( requireNonNullArgument( divisor, "divisor" ) ) );
220
221        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
222        return retValue;
223    }   //  divide()
224
225    /**
226     *  {@inheritDoc}<br>
227     *  <br>Two instances of a class implementing this interface are equals if
228     *  they are of the <i>same</i> class and if their values, converted to the
229     *  base dimension, are equals.
230     *
231     *  @param  o   The other value.
232     *  @return {@code true} if they are equal, {@code false} if not.
233     *
234     *  @see Object#equals(Object)
235     *  @see Dimension#baseUnit()
236     *  @see Dimension#factor()
237     */
238    @Override
239    public boolean equals( final Object o );
240
241    /**
242     *  {@inheritDoc}<br>
243     *  <br>The precision is applied to the numerical part only. The width
244     *  includes the
245     *  {@linkplain Dimension#unitSymbol() unit symbol}, too.
246     *
247     *  @note In case the {@code formatter} argument is {@code null} throws a
248     *      {@link NullPointerException}
249     *      and <i>not</i> the usual
250     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.NullArgumentException NullArgumentException},
251     *      because this method is usually called by instances of
252     *      {@link java.util.Formatter}
253     *      that does not know about our special exceptions.
254     *
255     *  @throws NullPointerException    The {@code formatter} argument is
256     *      {@code null}.
257     *
258     *  @see java.util.Formattable#formatTo(java.util.Formatter, int, int, int)
259     */
260    @SuppressWarnings( "ProhibitedExceptionThrown" )
261    @Override
262    public default void formatTo( final Formatter formatter, final int flags, final int width, final int precision )
263    {
264        if( isNull( formatter ) ) throw new NullPointerException( "formatter is null" );
265
266        var s = toString( width, precision );
267
268        if( ((flags & LEFT_JUSTIFY) == LEFT_JUSTIFY) && (width > s.trim().length()) )
269        {
270            s = padRight( s.trim(), width );
271        }
272
273        /*
274         * We do not use Formatter.out().append() because we do not know how to
275         * handle the IOException that could be thrown from
276         * Appendable.append(). Using Formatter.format() assumes that Formatter
277         * knows ...
278         */
279        formatter.format( "%s", s );
280    }   //  formatTo()
281
282    /**
283     *  Returns the unit for the value.
284     *
285     *  @return The unit.
286     */
287    public D getUnit();
288
289    /**
290     *  {@inheritDoc}<br>
291     *  <br>The hash code is based on the
292     *  {@linkplain #baseValue() base value}
293     *  and
294     *  {@linkplain #baseUnit() base unit}
295     *  only.
296     */
297    @Override
298    public int hashCode();
299
300    /**
301     *  Multiplies the value by a dimension-less value and returns the result
302     *  without changing this instance.
303     *
304     *  @param  multiplicand The multiplier.
305     *  @return The new value.
306     */
307    public default DimensionedValue<D> multiply( final BigDecimal multiplicand )
308    {
309        final var retValue = newInstance( baseUnit(), baseValue().multiply( requireNonNullArgument( multiplicand, "multiplicand" ) ) );
310        retValue.setUnit( getUnit() );
311
312        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
313        return retValue;
314    }   //  multiply()
315
316    /**
317     *  Multiplies the value by a dimension-less value and returns the result
318     *  without changing this instance.
319     *
320     *  @param  multiplicand The multiplier.
321     *  @return The new value.
322     */
323    public default DimensionedValue<D> multiply( final Number multiplicand )
324    {
325        final var retValue = multiply( new BigDecimal( requireNonNullArgument( multiplicand, "multiplicand" ).toString() ) );
326        retValue.setUnit( getUnit() );
327
328        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
329        return retValue;
330    }   //  multiply()
331
332    /**
333     *  Multiplies the value by a dimension-less value and returns the result
334     *  without changing this instance.
335     *
336     *  @param  multiplicand The multiplier; it must be possible to parse the
337     *      given String into a
338     *      {@link BigDecimal}.
339     *  @return The new value.
340     *  @throws NumberFormatException   The provided value cannot be converted
341     *      into a {@code BigDecimal}.
342     *
343     *  @see BigDecimal#BigDecimal(String)
344     */
345    public default DimensionedValue<D> multiply( final String multiplicand )
346    {
347        final var retValue = multiply( new BigDecimal( requireNonNullArgument( multiplicand, "multiplicand" ) ) );
348
349        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
350        return retValue;
351    }   //  multiply()
352
353    /**
354     *  Creates an instance for the class.
355     *
356     *  @param  dimension   The dimension for the new instance.
357     *  @param  value   The value for the new instance.
358     *  @return The new instance.
359     */
360    public default DimensionedValue<D> newInstance( final D dimension, final BigDecimal value )
361    {
362        DimensionedValue<D> retValue = null;
363
364        try
365        {
366            //---* Let's get the constructor *---------------------------------
367            final Constructor<DimensionedValue<D>> constructor;
368            if( requireNonNullArgument( dimension, "dimension" ) instanceof Enum<?> enumConstant )
369            {
370                final var enumClass = enumConstant.getDeclaringClass();
371                //noinspection unchecked
372                constructor = (Constructor<DimensionedValue<D>>) getClass().getConstructor( enumClass, BigDecimal.class );
373            }
374            else
375            {
376                throw new IllegalArgumentException( format( "Invalid type for 'dimension': %s", dimension.getClass().getName() ) );
377            }
378
379            //---* Create the new value *----------------------------------
380            retValue = constructor.newInstance( dimension, requireNonNullArgument( value, "value" ) );
381        }
382        catch( final NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException | InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException e )
383        {
384            throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( e );
385        }
386
387        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
388        return retValue;
389    }   //  newInstance()
390
391    /**
392     *  Applies another unit for the value. This does not affect the results
393     *  of
394     *  {@link #equals(Object)},
395     *  {@link #hashCode()}}
396     *  and
397     *  {@link #compareTo(DimensionedValue)},
398     *  nor that of
399     *  {@link #baseValue()}.
400     *
401     *  @param  unit    The new unit.
402     */
403    public void setUnit( D unit );
404
405    /**
406     *  Creates a new instance with the sum of this and the given value, and
407     *  returns that.
408     *
409     *  @param  unit    The unit for the new instance.
410     *  @param  summand The value to add.
411     *  @return The instance with the sum.
412     */
413    public default DimensionedValue<D> sum( final D unit, final DimensionedValue<D> summand )
414    {
415        final var retValue = sum( summand );
416        retValue.setUnit( unit );
417
418        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
419        return retValue;
420    }   //  sum()
421
422    /**
423     *  Creates a new instance with the sum of this and the given value, and
424     *  returns that. The unit for the new instance is that of this instance.
425     *
426     *  @param  summand The value to add.
427     *  @return The instance with the sum.
428     */
429    public default DimensionedValue<D> sum( final DimensionedValue<D> summand )
430    {
431        final var newValue = baseValue().add( requireNonNullArgument( summand, "summand" ).baseValue(), MATH_CONTEXT );
432        final var retValue = newInstance( baseUnit(), newValue );
433
434        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
435        return retValue;
436    }   // sum()
437
438    /**
439     *  <p>{@summary Returns the String representation for this value};
440     *  usually, this is in the format</p>
441     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>unit symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
442     *  <p>like &quot;{@code 4.5 m}&quot;.</p>
443     *  <p>The precision for the mantissa is
444     *  provided by the
445     *  {@linkplain Dimension#getPrecision() unit}.</p>
446     *  <p>If more control over the output format is required, see
447     *  {@link #toString(int, int)}.</p>
448     */
449    @Override
450    public String toString();
451
452    /**
453     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
454     *  format</p>
455     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>unit symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
456     *  <p>for the given
457     *  {@link Locale}
458     *  that determines the decimal separator, like &quot;{@code 4.5 m}&quot;
459     *  vs. &quot;{@code 4,5 m}&quot;.</p>
460     *  <p>The precision is applied to the numerical part only. The width
461     *  includes the
462     *  {@linkplain Dimension#unitSymbol() unit symbol}, too.</p>
463     *
464     *  @param  locale  The locale to use.
465     *  @param  width   The minimum number of characters to be written to the
466     *      output. If the length of the converted value is less than the width
467     *      then the output will be padded by '&nbsp;' until the total number
468     *      of characters equals width. The padding is at the beginning, as
469     *      numerical values are usually right justified. If {@code width} is
470     *      -1 then there is no minimum.
471     *  @param  precision – The number of digits for the mantissa of the value.
472     *      If {@code precision} is -1 then there is no explicit limit on the
473     *      size of the mantissa.
474     *  @return The String representation for this value.
475     */
476    public default String toString( final Locale locale, final int width, final int precision )
477    {
478        final var retValue = toString( locale, width, precision, false );
479
480        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
481        return retValue;
482    }   //  toString()
483
484    /**
485     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
486     *  format</p>
487     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>unit symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
488     *  <p>for the given
489     *  {@link Locale}
490     *  that determines the decimal separator, like &quot;{@code 4.5 m}&quot;
491     *  vs. &quot;{@code 4,5 m}&quot;.</p>
492     *  <p>The precision is applied to the numerical part only. The width
493     *  includes the
494     *  {@linkplain Dimension#unitSymbol() unit symbol}, too.</p>
495     *
496     *  @param  locale  The locale to use.
497     *  @param  width   The minimum number of characters to be written to the
498     *      output. If the length of the converted value is less than the width
499     *      then the output will be padded by '&nbsp;' until the total number
500     *      of characters equals width. The padding is at the beginning, as
501     *      numerical values are usually right justified. If {@code width} is
502     *      -1 then there is no minimum.
503     *  @param  precision – The number of digits for the mantissa of the value.
504     *      If {@code precision} is -1 then there is no explicit limit on the
505     *      size of the mantissa.
506     *  @param  useNiceUnit {@code true} if the method
507     *      {@link Dimension#unitSymbolForPrinting() unitSymbolForPrinting()}
508     *      should be used to retrieve the unit symbol, {@code false} if the
509     *      usual one is sufficient.
510     *  @return The String representation for this value.
511     */
512    public default String toString( final Locale locale, final int width, final int precision, final boolean useNiceUnit )
513    {
514        final var unitSymbol = useNiceUnit ? getUnit().unitSymbolForPrinting() : getUnit().unitSymbol();
515        final var effectiveWidth = width - unitSymbol.length() - 1;
516
517        final var format = new StringBuilder( "%" );
518        if( effectiveWidth > 0 ) format.append( effectiveWidth );
519        if( precision >= 0 ) format.append( "." ).append( precision );
520        format.append( "f %s" );
521
522        final var retValue = format( requireNonNullArgument( locale, "locale" ), format.toString(), value(), unitSymbol );
523
524        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
525        return retValue;
526    }   //  toString()
527
528    /**
529     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
530     *  format</p>
531     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>unit symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
532     *  <p>and for the
533     *  {@linkplain Locale#getDefault() default Locale},
534     *  like &quot;{@code 4.5 m}&quot;, where the Locale determines the decimal
535     *  separator.</p>
536     *  <p>The precision is applied to the numerical part only. The width
537     *  includes the
538     *  {@linkplain Dimension#unitSymbol() unit symbol}, too.</p>
539     *
540     *  @param  width   The minimum number of characters to be written to the
541     *      output. If the length of the converted value is less than the width
542     *      then the output will be padded by '&nbsp;' until the total number
543     *      of characters equals width. The padding is at the beginning, as
544     *      numerical values are usually right justified. If {@code width} is
545     *      -1 then there is no minimum.
546     *  @param  precision – The number of digits for the mantissa of the value.
547     *      If {@code precision} is -1 then there is no explicit limit on the
548     *      size of the mantissa.
549     *  @return The String representation for this value.
550     */
551    public default String toString( final int width, final int precision )
552    {
553        final var retValue = toString( Locale.getDefault(), width, precision );
554
555        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
556        return retValue;
557    }   //  toString()
558
559    /**
560     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
561     *  format that is defined by the provided format String.</p>
562     *  <p>That format String must contain exactly one '%f' tag and one '%s'
563     *  tag; the first takes the numerical value, the second the unit.</p>
564     *  <p>The provided
565     *  {@link Locale}
566     *  determines the decimal separator and the optional thousands
567     *  separator.</p>
568     *
569     *  @param  locale  The locale to use.
570     *  @param  format  The format String.
571     *  @param  useNiceUnit {@code true} if the method
572     *      {@link Dimension#unitSymbolForPrinting() unitSymbolForPrinting()}
573     *      should be used to retrieve the unit symbol, {@code false} if the
574     *      usual one is sufficient.
575     *  @return The String representation for this value.
576     *  @throws IllegalFormatException  The provided format String is invalid.
577     *
578     *  @see java.util.Formatter
579     */
580    public default String toString( final Locale locale, final String format, final boolean useNiceUnit ) throws IllegalFormatException
581    {
582        final var unitSymbol = useNiceUnit ? getUnit().unitSymbolForPrinting() : getUnit().unitSymbol();
583        final var retValue = format( requireNonNullArgument( locale, "locale" ), requireNotEmptyArgument( format, "format" ), value(), unitSymbol );
584
585        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
586        return retValue;
587    }   //  toString()
588
589    /**
590     *  Returns the numerical value.
591     *
592     *  @return The numerical value, based on current dimension.
593     */
594    public default BigDecimal value() { return convert( getUnit() ); }
595}
596//  interface DimensionedValue
597
598/*
599 *  End of File
600 */
